text:
Based on the fact this role is a set 20/40 hours a week, my guess is that this is a role from a temp agency rather than a direct hire.

Assuming that's the case - then the rate will almost always be based on hours. In the San Francisco Bay area- I've seen junior writing roles average around $25-30/hour which I think is a fair rate even in lower cost of living regions.

Now, if this is a direct consulting role (e.g. 1099) - which in this scenario would open the company to severe misclassification tax penalties (a whole separate topic for discussion) -> I'd add 15%-20% to the range I just mentioned to offset the costs of self employment taxes and such. For mid/senior level - I'd bump up the markup higher, but for a junior role I think there's less wiggle room.
